intro: Bunchosia hartwegiana, commonly known as the Brazilian hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are ovate and hairy, while its fruits are capsule-like and contain small, smooth seeds.
